alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 24 at 3:25AM CST until January 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph possible. * WHERE...In Alabama, Choctaw, Clarke, Wilcox, Monroe, Conecuh, Butler, Crenshaw, Escambia and Covington Counties. In Mississippi, Wayne County. * WHEN...From this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains some uncertainty on how strong the winds will be across the High Wind Watch. We will closely monitor trends today and the watch will either be replaced with a wind advisory or upgraded to a high wind warning depending on the trends.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
